sentence: S ince dividends come out of a company's bottom line, looking for stocks with a steady earnings track record is a sound strategy.
IBD's Dividend Leaders list consists of some of the most stable profit generators.
The EPS Stability Factor takes a company's quarterly earnings per share over the past three to five years and measures how much they fluctuate from their core trend.
The result is assigned a number from 0 (most stable) to 99 (most volatile).
The stocks in the Dividend Leaders screen are in the steadier part of that scale.
Four stocks on the list currently earn a 1 for that metric:Altria Group ( MO ),Home Depot ( HD ),Paychex ( PAYX ) andReynolds American ( RAI ).
Altria on Thursday reported Q1 results that beat views for sales and profit.
The Marlboro maker has grown annual EPS by at least 8% in the past five years.
Analysts expect a 9% gain this year and 8% the next.
Altria pays a dividend of 52 cents a share, or $2.08 for the full year, for a 4% annualized yield.
The stock is shaping a flat base with a potential 56.79 buy point.
Home Depot has a five-year earnings growth rate of 23%.
Gains are expected to slow a bit to a still-solid 13% this year and 15% in 2016.
The home improvement giant's 59-cent payout yields 2.1% based on its current stock price.
The stock is trading near its 10-week moving average but is well extended after multiple visits to the line.
Paychex saw annual profit dip in 2009 and 2010, but has rebounded since for a five-year earnings growth rate of 6%.
Forecasts going forward are for 8% in the fiscal year, which ends in May, and 9% in the next fiscal year.
The stock's quarterly dividend of 39 cents a share translates into a 3.1% yield.
The stock has wavered since clearing a base in January.
Reynolds offers a 67-cent payout for a 3.5% yield .
The Camel and Pall Mall maker has a five-year EPS growth rate of 7%, with forecasts for a 12% rise this year and 8% the next.
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
